Pre-Game Insights: Lesotho turned in an impressive team display to hold Nigeria to a 1-1 draw, despite being on the back foot for most of the game.
Lesotho has now failed to win their last three matches, picking up one draw and losing twice.
Benin suffered a 2-1 defeat to South Africa in their most recent match.
Benin have now failed to win their last 13 matches across all competitions, losing eight and claiming five draws since a 4-0 friendly victory over Liberia in March 2022.
Lesotho and Benin have endured a rough year and will be looking to close out their schedule for 2023 on a positive note.
Gernot Rohr's men are unbeaten in their last two games against Lesotho and we see them claiming all three points on Tuesday, albeit by the odd goal.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lesotho's Motlomelo Mkwanazi scored in the 63rd minute, while Benin's Olaitan scored in the 86th minute.
Lesotho's Thabiso Brown came off injured at half time against Nigeria and is a doubt for Tuesday's game.
Benin's Steve Mounie has now moved into third place in Benin's all-time scoring chart.
